page.title: 14BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY. CUSTOMS.
page.content: {HAAF NETTING.}Men meet and draw for position in the line which extends at right angles to the shore. Fishing is done with a hand-held baulk (pole) approx.17feet long. Side poles are about 3 feet long and the middle pole about 6 feet. Fishermen stand up to their chest in the water and move inland as the tide comes in. Fish are caught in the two net bags which extend from the baulk. {PEAT CUTTING.}Peat digging rights are claimed in January by the householders who have such a right. {CARNIVAL. }This takes place each June. A Carnival queen and attendants lead a procession of imaginative floats around the village to the rectory garden. The queen is crowned. A trophy is awarded to the best float. Villagers enjoy sideshows and tea.
